question: Which three countries cover the "Napo Moist Forests"?
explanation: Napo Moist Forests is a neotropical type ecoregion which houses tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forests spread through countries such as Colombia, Ecuador and Peru. These forests form the basin of Napo, Caguan, Curaray, Maranon, Morona, Pastaza, Putumayo and Tigre rivers. The World Wildlife Fund gives the ecoregion the status of "Critically Endangered". These forests are protected and conserved through Cayambe Coca Ecological Reserve and Yasuni National Park of Ecuador.
